questions.question: On every continent, there is a city named what?
questions.answer: Rome. Rome was of course one of the first major city-states in history, and it was the center of an advanced empire. But did you know that each continent except Antarctica, currently has its own “Rome?” One example is America.

questions.question: What is the official nickname of Texas?
questions.answer: The Lone Star State. The star is a major symbol of Texas as it reflects their pride when it became independent from Mexico in 1836.

questions.question: Which planet is the hottest in the solar system?
questions.answer: Venus. A lot of people might assume that the “red planet” (Mars) is the hottest rock in our solar system, but the honor actually goes to Venus. It’s average temperature is 880°F (471°C) .

questions.question: What is the most common letter in the English alphabet?
questions.answer: E. Think about it. The letter “E” is in almost every word and sentence. Just try and count how many “E’s” there are in this sentence alone.

questions.question: The Beaver Is The National Emblem Of Which Country?
questions.answer: Canada. n the late 1600s, fur hats made of beaver pelts were successfully traded to Europe. As tribute, they put the beaver in their coat of arms, stamps, and emblems.

questions.question: If A Male Donkey Is A Jack, What Is The Female Called?
questions.answer: Jenny. Honestly, most people will have absolutely no hope of answering this question correctly. But hey, at least you’ll learn something.

questions.question: What Body Part Is Reshaped In Plastic Surgery Known As “Rhinoplasty”?
questions.answer: Nose. This also helps improve obstructed airways to help the person breathe better.

questions.question: Which Nuts Are Used To Make Marzipan?
questions.answer: Almonds. Marzipan, which is made of sugar and almond meal, is one of those candies that is slightly obscure, so you might catch a few people out with this somewhat difficult question.
